body: Also experiencing the same issue, but it only occurs when navigating **from and to** certain pages, most notably when attempting to navigate back to the applications **Home** page and when navigating from a page that utilizes `components.iframe` feature.

Thanks for reporting this, we are trying to diagnose the issue and seeing the same behavior of impacting some pages and not others without a really clear characteristic of what causes it to repro.

If anyone else has clear examples or hints about what might be causing certain pages to trigger this bug, please do share! Thank you!

> Thanks for reporting this, we are trying to diagnose the issue and seeing the same behavior of impacting some pages and not others without a really clear characteristic of what causes it to repro.
> 
> If anyone else has clear examples or hints about what might be causing certain pages to trigger this bug, please do share! Thank you!

@sfc-gh-jcarroll,

Thank you for looking into this.  It does seem pretty random, but one pattern that stands out to me is navigating from one page to another, then navigating back to the original page.  The error seems to occur on the second use of the `switch_page` in that specific scenario.

If you want to take a look at an example, I just pushed an update to my [Fin Stream app](https://fin-stream.streamlit.app/).  Each page now has a navigation drop-down menu located at the top of the page with buttons that utilize the `switch_page` feature.

=================================================================

**Using this app as an example, try navigating the application using the following sequence below.** 

**Home --> Dashboard --> Home**

[**Example App - Fin Stream**](https://fin-stream.streamlit.app/)

=================================================================


I hope this helps.  Please let me know if you have any questions.  Thank you

issue.title: Fix #7954

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit â€” A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
This PR fixes a small bug in the `AppSession._handle_scriptrunner_event_on_event_loop`
that manifested as #7954. The issue is that we don't modify our `AppSession`'s state to
`AppSessionState.APP_NOT_RUNNING` when processing a `ScriptRunnerEvent.SCRIPT_STOPPED_FOR_RERUN`
event (the `AppSession` is technically in the not running state for a short time until the rerun
starts, at which point it'll move back to running).

Forgetting to do this ended up causing a bug as a rerun request occurring quickly enough after
the script first started running could cause the `ForwardMsg.session_status_changed` msg being
sent from server->client to be lost (as the queued one is dropped before it makes it to the client, and
the rerun doesn't send a new session status changed message as it doesn't think the session status
has changed).

Closes #7954

body:
@vdonato I need to redact my previous comment. When I my application locally on my desktop, everything works fine. Unfortunately, once I pushed the update to the live version of the application hosted via Streamlit Community Cloud, the issue resurfaced.

[Fin-Stream - Example Application](https://fin-stream.streamlit.app/)
Thanks for the heads up @REPNOT -- I'll reopen this issue and spend some time investigating this tomorrow.
